info.description:
This is the internal version of the Swagger API generated from the Java
                                    resource objects and is not visible to external users.  It must be a superset
                                    of the more user-friendly Swagger API maintained manually at
                                    https://github.com/datadotworld/dwapi-spec.
info.title: data.world Public API (internal version)

post.summary: Create a new dataset.

put.summary: Replace an existing dataset or create a new dataset

post.summary: Add or update files for a dataset.

200.description: Dataset successfully updated with new sources. Sync in progress.
Dataset file(s) have been successfully deleted.

delete.summary: Delete a single file for a dataset.

200.description: Dataset file(s) have been successfully deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve queries saved in a dataset.

200.description: Successfully retrieved queries saved in a dataset.

post.summary: Create a saved query for a dataset

put.summary: Update a saved query for a dataset

delete.summary: Delete a saved query for a dataset

get.summary: Fetch latest files from source and update dataset â€” via GET, for convenience.

post.summary: Fetch latest files from source and update dataset.

200.description: DOI successfully added to dataset version.
DOI successfully removed from dataset version.

get.description:
This endpoint executes a SPARQL DESCRIBE query, given an IRI.
.
This endpoint will return a .zip of all files within the dataset."
This endpoint will return the file from the latest dataset version.

post.summary: Create new insight for a project.

put.summary: Replace an existing insight or create a new insight.

get.summary: Retrieve a project insight by version.

post.summary: Create a new analysis metadata.

put.summary: Replace an existing analysis or create a new analysis

post.summary: Create a new glossary metadata.

put.summary: Replace an existing glossary or create a new glossary

post.summary: Creates a relationship between two catalog resources
Deletes a relationship between two catalog resources
Get resources (data, analysis, and glossaries) that are related to a resource
Get resources (data, analysis, and glossaries) that are related to a table

head.summary: Check whether user credentials allow write access to the specified data.world account.

post.summary: Create a target dataset if it doesn't exist already.
Notify data.world that new files have been uploaded to S3.
Create a new project.

put.summary: Replace an existing project or create a new project.
Link a dataset to a project.

delete.summary: Remove a linked dataset from a project.

get.summary: Retrieve queries saved in a project.

200.description: Successfully retrieved queries saved in a project.

post.summary: Create a saved query for a project

put.summary: Update a saved query for a project

delete.summary: Delete a saved query for a project

post.summary: Execute a query.

200.description: Successfully retrieved a version query definition.

post.summary: Simple search on resources.

get.description:
This endpoint executes SPARQL queries against a dataset.
New to SPARQL? Check out data.world's [SPARQL tutorial](https://docs.data.world/tutorials/sparql/) .

post.summary: SPARQL query
post.description:
his endpoint executes SPARQL queries against a dataset.
New to SPARQL? Check out data.world's [SPARQL tutorial](https://docs.data.world/tutorials/sparql/) .

get.description:
This endpoint executes SQL queries against a dataset.
New to SQL? Check out data.world's [SQL manual](https://docs.data.world/tutorials/dwsql/) .

post.summary: SQL query
post.description:
This endpoint executes SQL queries against a dataset.
New to SQL? Check out data.world's [SQL manual](https://docs.data.world/tutorials/dwsql/) .

post.summary: Append record(s) to a stream.

delete.summary: Delete all records uploaded to the stream.

get.summary: Get the configured record schema for a stream.

patch.summary: Update the record schema of a stream.

post.summary: Upload one or more files to a dataset.
post.description: Swagger clients will limit this method of upload to one file at a time. Other HTTP clients capable of making multipart/form-data requests can be used to upload multiple files in a single request.

put.summary: Upload a file to a dataset.
put.description: This method of upload is not supported by Swagger clients. Other HTTP clients can be used to supply the contents of the file directly in the body of the request

get.summary: Fetch datasets to which the requesting user is a contributor
Fetch datasets the requesting user likes
Fetch datasets the requesting user owns
Fetch organizations to which the requesting user is a member
Fetch projects to which the requesting user is a contributor
Fetch projects the requesting user likes
Fetch projects the requesting user owns
Fetch a webhook subscription for a dataset.

put.summary: Create a webhook subscription for a dataset including objects owned by it.

delete.summary: Delete a webhook subscription for a dataset.

get.summary: Fetch a webhook subscription for a project.

put.summary: Create a webhook subscription for a project including objects owned by it.

delete.summary: Delete a webhook subscription for a project.

get.summary: Fetch a webhook subscription for a user account.

put.summary: Create a webhook subscription for a user account including objects owned by it.

delete.summary: Delete a webhook subscription for a user account.

scopes.user_api_read: Permission to read the data and metadata contained in datasets and data projects to which you have access.
scopes.user_api_write: Permission to update the data and metadata contained in datasets and data projects to which you have write access.
scopes.user_api_admin: Permission to access administrative features, including permission to delete datasets and data projects.

sourceDatasetId.description: If source is a table or column, populate with dataset ID that contains table.

sourceTableId.description: If source is a column, populate with table ID that contains column.

targetDatasetId.description: If target is a table or column, populate with dataset ID that contains table.

targetTableId.description: If target is a column, populate with table ID that contains column.
